src:
El imperdible encuentro entre "Mala fama" y "Pepe" Mujica

07 Nov 2019, 13:40


El cantante de cumbia fue a visitar al reconocido político uruguayo a su casa. Mujica lo recibió, tomaron mates y salió una imperdible charla.

José “Pepe” Mujica, expresidente de Uruguay, recibió en su humilde casa al conocido músico de cumbia villera “Mala Fama” que se encontraba realizando una gira por el país vecino.
Entre mate y mate, el político charló con el cantante y le mostró unos escritos inéditos que atesora del “Che” Guevara. Además, contó que hace pocos días estuvo con el presidente electo Alberto Fernández en el Nacional de Buenos Aires: “había una bandada de gurises”, comentó Mujica.
En su despedida, Mala Fama le agradeció por recibirlo en su casa: “te recontra agradezco, viva la gente humilde y me encanta tu habitad. Nunca sabemos cuándo vamos a morir pero… ahora que estamos vivos, es un terrible honor conocerte”.

text:
The unmissable encounter between "Bad Fame" and "Pepe" Mujica

07 Nov 2019, 13:40


The cumbia singer went to visit the renowned Uruguayan politician at his home. Mujica received it, they took mates and an unmissable talk came out.

José "Pepe" Mujica, former president of Uruguay, received in his humble house the well-known cumbia musician villera "Mala Fama" who was touring the neighboring country.
Between mate and mate, the politician chatted with the singer and showed him some unpublished writings that he treasures of "Che" Guevara. In addition, he said that a few days ago he was with President-elect Alberto Fernández in the National of Buenos Aires: “there was a flock of gurises,” said Mujica.
In his farewell, Mala Fama thanked him for receiving him at his home: “I thank you again, I live the humble people and I love your habit. We never know when we are going to die but… now that we are alive, it is a terrible honor to meet you. ”
